name: Facebook
description: The world’s largest social networking site, connecting people, businesses, and communities through posts, groups, and pages.

name: Instagram
description: A photo and video sharing social media app, popular for stories, reels, and influencer-driven marketing.

name: Twitter (X)
description: A microblogging platform rebranded as X, widely used for real-time news, discussions, and public conversations.

name: LinkedIn
description: A professional networking platform focused on careers, business connections, and B2B marketing.

name: YouTube
description: The world’s largest video-sharing platform, hosting content ranging from entertainment to education and live streams.

name: TikTok
description: A short-form video platform known for viral trends, music, and creative content, especially among younger audiences.

name: Pinterest
description: A visual discovery and bookmarking platform where users save and share creative ideas, products, and inspirations.

name: Snapchat
description: A multimedia messaging app known for disappearing photos, videos, and creative AR filters.

name: Reddit
description: A social news aggregation and discussion website, organized into topic-based communities called subreddits.

name: WhatsApp
description: A messaging app owned by Meta, offering free text, voice, video calling, and group chat services globally.

name: Telegram
description: A cloud-based messaging app known for speed, security, and support for large groups and channels.

name: Discord
description: A voice, video, and community chat app originally for gamers, now widely used for online communities and groups.

name: WeChat
description: China’s super app, combining messaging, payments, social networking, and services in one platform.

name: Tumblr
description: A microblogging and social platform for creative expression, used for sharing multimedia content and fandom culture.

name: Threads
description: Meta’s text-based conversation app linked with Instagram, positioned as an alternative to Twitter/X.
